Item HIT Text: Comatose during 3 day assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: No|Yes

Item HIT Text: Expression of ideas and wants during 3 day assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: Rarely/Never expresses self or speech is very difficult to understand|Exhibits some difficulty with expressing needs and ideas (e.g., some words or finishing thoughts) or speech is not clear|Expresses complex messages without difficulty and with speech that is clear and easy to understand|Frequently exhibits difficulty with expressing needs and ideas

Item HIT Text: Understanding verbal and non-verbal content during 3 day assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: Understands clear comprehension without cues or repetitions|Usually understands: understands most conversations, but misses some part/intent of message.  Requires cues at times to understand.|Sometimes understands: Understands only basic conversations or simple, direct phrases.  Frequently requires cues to understand.|Rarely/never understands

Item HIT Text: Signs and symptoms of delirium (from CAM) [CMS Assessment]
Is there evidence of an acute change in mental status from the patient's baseline during 3 day assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: No|Yes

Item HIT Text: Did the (abnormal) behavior fluctuate during the day, that is, tend to come and go or increase and decrease in severity during 3 day assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: No|Yes

Item HIT Text: Did the patient have difficulty focusing attention, for example, being easily distractible or having difficulty keeping track of what was being said during 3 day assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: No|Yes

Item HIT Text: Was the patient's thinking disorganized or incoherent, such as rambling or irrelevant conversation, unclear or illogical flow of ideas, or unpredictable switching from subject to subject during 3 day assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: No|Yes

Short Name: Overall, how would you rate the {patient's/resident's} level of consciousness?
Item HIT Text: Altered level of consciousness [CMS Assessment]
Level of consciousness - Alert (normal) during 3 day assessment [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: No|Yes

Item HIT Text: Level of consciousness - Vigilant or lethargic or stupor or coma during 3 day assessment [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: No|Yes

Item HIT Text: LCDS - Prior functioning: everyday activities [CMS Assessment]
Indoor mobility (Ambulation) [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: Independent - patient completed the activities by him/herself, with or without an assistive device, with no assistance from a helper.|Dependent - a helper completed the activity for the patient.|Needed some help - patient needed partial assistance from another person to complete activities.|Unknown|Not applicable

Short Name: Prior device use. Check all that apply
Item HIT Text: Prior device use [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: Mechanical lift|Manual wheelchair|Motorized wheelchair or scooter|None of the above

Item HIT Text: Eating - functional ability during 3 day assessment period [CMS Assessment]
Response HIT Text: Partial/moderate assistance - Helper does less than half the effort. Helper lifts, holds or supports trunk or limbs, but provides less than half the effort.|Patient refused|Setup or clean-up assistance - Helper sets up or cleans up; patient completes activity. Helper assists only prior to or following the activity.|Substantial/maximal assistance - Helper does more than half the effort. Helper lifts or holds trunk or limbs and provides more than half the effort.|Not attempted due to medical condition or safety concerns|Dependent - Helper does all of the effort. Patient does none of the effort to complete the activity. Or, the assistance of 2 or more helpers is required for the patient to complete the activity.|Supervision or touching assistance - Helper provides verbal cues and/or touching/steadying and/or contact guard assistance as patient completes activity. Assistance may be provided throughout the activity or intermittently.|Not applicable - Not attempted and the patient did not perform this activity prior to the current illness, exacerbation, or injury.|Not attempted due to environmental limitations (e.g. lack of equipment, weather constraints).|Independent - Patient completes the activity by him/herself with no assistance from a helper.
